meta.notes: Mid-handicap right-handed player with left eye dominance, playing mid-irons.

summary.headline: Solid fundamentals with room to gain consistency and power through better pivot and clubface control.
bullets: Good setup posture and balanced stance.
Tendency to have an open clubface at impact causing slight fades or slices.
Pivot timing inconsistent, leading to varying contact and distance control.
Swing path sometimes off-line, creating direction challenges.
Low point often behind the ball, leading to thin or fat shots.

strengths: Balanced and athletic setup position promoting good rotation potential.
Good wrist hinge on the takeaway, promoting solid swing length.
Maintains head position well through the swing, aiding contact.
Able to shallow the club on downswing occasionally leading to better strike.

priorityFixes.title: Improve clubface control
priorityFixes.detail: Work on achieving a square clubface at impact to reduce fades and regain straighter ball flights.

priorityFixes.title: Enhance pivot timing
priorityFixes.detail: Develop a smoother and better timed hip rotation to generate more power and improve contact consistency.

priorityFixes.title: Correct low point control
priorityFixes.detail: Train to shift the low point slightly forward to ensure clean ball-first contact, reducing thin or fat shots.

powerLeaks: Early extension in the downswing reducing leverage and power.
Weak hip clearance limiting turn and clubhead speed.
Over-rotation of the forearms causing off-plane swings.
Lack of weight transfer onto the front foot at impact.

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Good athletic posture with balanced weight distribution.
errors: Sometimes the ball position drifts too far forward or back.
Hands occasionally too far ahead or behind the ball.
drills: Use alignment rods to check consistent ball and foot position.
Practice setup in front of a mirror focusing on spine angle.

checkpoints.label: Takeaway
checkpoints.note: Smooth one-piece takeaway with proper wrist hinge.
errors: Occasional overuse of hands instead of body.
Club sometimes too flat or too steep early.
drills: Slow-motion takeaway focusing on body rotation.
Use a headcover under the lead arm drill to maintain connection.

checkpoints.label: Top of Backswing
checkpoints.note: Good width but sometimes arm gets too steep or dropped.
errors: Excessive cupping or flipping of wrist.
Swing plane too steep causing loss of width.
drills: Swing with impact tape to check clubface orientation.
Pause at top and check arm position with mirror.

checkpoints.label: Transition
checkpoints.note: Timing issues causing early hand and wrist firing.
drills: Count tempo drills – saying 'one-two' during swing.
Pump drill: pause mid-downswing and complete swing slowly.

checkpoints.label: Downswing
checkpoints.note: Swing path tends to be outside-in causing fades or slices.
errors: Overuse of wrists leading to open face.
drills: Gate drill for inside path awareness.
Focus on feeling the trail hip clearing through impact.

checkpoints.label: Impact
checkpoints.note: Clubface often open and low point just behind ball.
errors: Weight not fully shifted onto lead foot.
drills: Impact bag drill to promote square face and forward shaft lean.
Step-through drill to encourage weight transfer.

checkpoints.label: Release
checkpoints.note: Hands sometimes roll too early causing loss of power.
drills: Video swing checkpoints focusing on forearm rotation timing.
Slow-motion swings focusing on late and controlled release.

checkpoints.label: Finish
drills: Hold finish pose for 3 seconds after each shot.
Practice with feet close together to improve balance.

checkpoints.label: Start line control
checkpoints.note: Tendency for shots to start right of target due to path/face issue.
errors: Open clubface at address or impact.
drills: Place gate sticks down target line to check path.
Use impact tape to monitor clubface angle at impact.

practicePlan.overview: Next 14 days focus on improving clubface control and pivot timing with drills that build consistency in impact position and power generation. Work on sequencing to fix transition and downswing path issues. Establish solid low point awareness and weight transfer.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Setup & Takeaway Checks
days.detail: Use alignment rods to refine ball position and stance. Practice slow takeaway maintaining body rotation and proper wrist hinge with mirror or video feedback.

days.label: DAYS 3–5: Transition & Downswing Path
days.focus: Smooth transition and inside swing path
days.detail: Implement tempo drills like 'one-two' rhythm and pump drills for better transition feel. Use gate drill to develop an inside-out swing path, recording video for review.

days.label: DAYS 6–8: Impact Position & Weight Shift
days.focus: Square clubface and low point control
days.detail: Use impact bag drills and step-throughs to promote forward shaft lean and weight transfer. Focus on striking the ball before the ground consistently.

days.label: DAYS 9–11: Release & Power Generation
days.focus: Proper release timing and hip turn
days.detail: Slow-motion swings emphasizing late, controlled release. Add hip turn drills for better clearance and power generation without early extension.

days.label: DAYS 12–14: Integration & Consistency
days.focus: Combine all improvements into full swings
days.detail: Hit 7-iron shots focusing on square face, inside swing path, proper weight transfer, and balanced finish. Take notes or video to track progress and fine-tune.
